concept.title: User Roles

audience.otherprops: community engagement officers, project managers, program administrators, public information coordinators, external stakeholders, contractors, agency leadership

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Describes the system roles available in the application, including Super User, Campaign Manager, and Reviewer, and outlines their permissions and operational scope.

othermeta.name: entities
othermeta.content: super user role;campaign manager role;reviewer role;application settings;user administration module;campaign reports

othermeta.name: usecase
othermeta.content: define and describe system roles and their permissions

conbody.p: The application supports the following roles for a user:

section.title: Super User
section.p: The Super User is authorized to access the user administration module in the application. The Super User is responsible for all the user management activities such as user creation, modification, and deletion. A Super User can create another super user in the system by assigning Administrator role to a user.

section.title: Campaign Manager
section.p: The Campaign Manager is responsible for managing and supervising tasks, features, and other related elements appropriate to a specific campaign. The Campaign Manager is restricted to use Application Settings.

section.title: Reviewer
section.p: The Reviewer can review a campaign, review a project in a campaign, generate reports, and see insights. The Reviewer is restricted to use Application Settings.
